metadata.Title: CVE-2021-32557 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that the process_report() function indata/whoopsie-upload-all allowed arbitrary file writes via symlinks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-32557` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
apport-gtk - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
apport-kde - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
apport-noui - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
apport-retrace - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
apport-valgrind - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
dh-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
python-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
python-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
python3-apport - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
python3-problem-report - 2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apport package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.20.1-0ubuntu2.30+esm1').
